text: hi everyone
Anthony Fantana here Internet's busiest
music nerd and it's time for a review of
the new mount kimby album cold spring
fault les youth these guys are a
uk-based electronic music duo this is
their sophomore full-length LP their
full-length debut crooks and lovers was
easily one of the most buzzed-about
electronic music albums of 2010 and that
LP stylistically featured a lot of
dubstep sounds future garage sounds a
little bit of wonky as well and they're
really going for a noticeable change of
pace on this new record with more vocals
more live instrumentation guitars drums
they even have some vocal features on
here from King cruel AKA zu kid on two
different tracks one of those two tracks
you took your time is actually one of my
favorite tracks off of this LP I loved
it as the record label Warp Records
dropped the song up to the release of
this album and part of the reason I love
the track so much is because King cruel
is incredibly passionate and convincing
as a vocalist yes he's not always there
in terms of pitch but I feel like when
he dips in out of it it's because he's
sort of really overacting and just
really bringing something that's ah it's
in me right here however the vocals that
mount Kimi brings to the table on
numerous tracks from this LP not as
gripping a lot of the vocals that mount
can be offers are very faint they're
obscured a little bit too much by reverb
and and in my opinion somewhat
passionless and the vocals really are a
consistent issue for me on this LP
there's not really one single track on
this album where I like them however
that's not really the only thing keeping
me back from enjoying this release for
one I think the recording on this album
is a little too low by really and that
could possibly be the case due to the
title of the opening track on this thing
the home recording reference and you
know for sure there are some great
lo-fi records out there fantastic lo-fi
records really but I I think that this
recording quality bites this record in
the but it really bites the duo in the
but on here mostly because of the fact
that the sounds really are not that
vivid they're they're not that unique or
interesting and the the melodies aren't
really vivid enough to cut through the
extreme amount of reverb and again just
how faint some of these sounds are I
know Mount can be from their from their
debut tend to run a little subtle but
the the consistently murky flavors on
this record just really takes the life
out of some of these sounds listening to
the songs that were dropping from the
cell P as they were being released was
okay you know one or two tracks at a
time but as a listening experience as a
full-length listening experience this
record can get a little monotonous not
only can the sounds be pretty faint but
the songs as well in terms of of
structure the song made to stray is is
one of the better pieces of drum
programming on this LP it's got a nice
beat to it it's very busy it's very
detailed but the progressions really
aren't there to keep the song
interesting from beginning to end
it gets really dull and when the vocals
come in again they don't really add that
much change to the overall feel the
track because of just how unengaging
they are there are other tracks on here
like break well which don't really peter
out into a full song it brings an
interesting synthesizer idea or just
kind of a motif like thing and then it
cuts out and while some songs are short
others seem to kind of drag on a little
bit the song blood in form is one of the
most obtuse tracks on this album it has
the oddest most off-kilter beat and a
lot of the sounds throughout this
tracker just so sour and kind of
unrewarding it's it's really a jumble a
kind of unrewarding jumble i think as
far as some of the instrumental pieces
like toward the back end of this LP
where I'm hearing what feels like more
live instrumentation I mean the
performances are fine mount kimby is
most certainly tight nothing feels
incredibly out of place but it's just
all too breezy there's just not a lot
for me to I feel like latch onto with
this album the music just wasn't really
moving to me there weren't many moments
that offend
me but I feel like this album is sort of
like a minefield of boredom I know
that's brutal I know that's just a you
know a harsh thing to say but I just
don't really care for it there's not
much on this record that that I enjoy
listening to unfortunately if you've
given this LP listen what did you think
of it did you love it did you hate it
why what do you think I should review
next and that's it thank you for
watching
Anthony Fantan Oh Mount Kim be forever
you
